channel.title: PostStalker
channel.description:
Since I needed something like this, I quickly wrote it in Java.
[b]What?[/b]
You can use PostStalker to keep up to date with content-changes on a site. A more specific example: this forum.
Some pictures to illustrate (I made this for another forum, a dutch forum): 1. After adding 5 topics to PostStalker [img]http://oi57.tinypic.com/2mxfrrq.jpg[/img] 2. and 3. After commenting on one of those five topics [img]http://oi62.tinypic.com/103a7nk.jpg[/img] [img]http://oi58.tinypic.com/4k7d53.jpg[/img]
[b]How?[/b]
Enter a title (optional) in the first textfield, the url of the topic in the second and the 'filter word' in the third. The filter word is the word which indicates a new message in the page's source. On this forum that would be: <div class="post">
[b]Some coming features[/b] * PostStalker starts when you boot your pc * When you close PostStalker your current config gets saved to check for new posts when you open it again * User can change the refresh rate (right now it's at 30sec)
If you have any suggestions feel free to post them here!
[b]Download[/b] [url=http://www.mediafire.com/download/cp5mm980weecp3z/PostStalker.jar]PostStalker.jar[/url] (14.43KB) [url=https://www.mediafire.com/?r6hezvmey3et1zi]Source[/url] (7.7KB)
